definition: A simple drawing that explains how something works or shows parts; to show or explain with a diagram.
examples: We drew a diagram of the water cycle. (noun)
The teacher diagrammed the sentence on the board. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Diagram = draw to make ideas clear.

definition: To block success or make someone feel annoyed by stopping their plans.
examples: Cancelled trains frustrated commuters.
Complicated rules can frustrate learners.

definition: To finish a course of study; a person who has finished a course; relating to someone who has completed a degree.
examples: She will graduate in June. (verb)
He is a science graduate. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Graduate = ‘grade you ate’—you finished that level.

definition: A playful trick; to play a trick on someone.
examples: The April Fools’ prank made everyone laugh. (noun)
Please don’t prank the new students. (verb)

definition: First or most important; relating to early years of schooling; in some countries, an election to choose a party’s candidate.
examples: Safety is our primary concern. (adjective)
She teaches primary pupils. (adjective)

definition: The chance of loss or danger; to expose to the chance of loss or danger.
examples: There is a risk of rain today. (noun)
Don’t risk your health by skipping sleep. (verb)

definition: Pressure or worry; in speech, extra emphasis on a syllable; to give special importance or pressure.
examples: Exams can cause stress. (noun)
Teachers stress the need for practice. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Stress = press down on mind or meaning.

definition: To strongly advise or try to persuade; a strong desire to do something.
examples: Doctors urge people to drink water in hot weather. (verb)
He had an urge to call his friend. (noun)

definition: Empty or not being used; showing no expression.
examples: There is a vacant seat by the window.
He stared with a vacant look.

extra.memory_tip: Vacant = a ‘vacuum’ of people or expression.

definition: Strong and full of energy; done with force or enthusiasm.
examples: She gave the carpet a vigorous shake.
A vigorous debate lasted an hour.
